poem:
Title: "Exodus as Undertow"

Palestinians in plight, like petals on a wind,
driven to Egypt's hands - a desert cradle.
Peace process, an elusive moth in the lantern's edge,
nudged towards the coffin nail, sustains still.
UN's chief, a lighthouse in the tempest,
His voice carries the bled-dry, back to the olive trees.
Time ticks like prayer beads in Damascus,
And the world awaits their return journey.
